result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.
Notice of Expert Testimony, received and filed.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court with Curtis L Schmitt Jr.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has received all discovery.  Defense to consult with a computer forensic expert and request a jury trial date.

Defendant is in compliance with JusticePoint.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 6 person scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.
Stipulation and order Regarding Defendant's Bail Conditions, signed and filed.
STIPULATION AND ORDER REGARDING DEFENDANT'S BAIL CONDITIONS, received and filed.
Off the record the parties has reached a stipulation.  An order will be submitted.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on September 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

OFF THE RECORD.

Attorney Karshen is currently in trial.   Defense has received new discovery and request a 30 day status date.  Date picked through email thread between parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Defendant Curtis L Schmitt in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Jack T Eichorst, appearing for Erin Karshen, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Court is advised that there is a significant delay obtaining information regarding some of the discovery.
Defense counsel requests further adjournment for status.

Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 15.

Received and Filed. Address Change Notification

Defendant Curtis L Schmitt in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  
Jennifer Jean Tate appeared on the behalf of Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests adjournment due to delay in DCI discovery from the State. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Curtis L Schmitt in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  
Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law as there is no victim. Defense in receipt of recent voluminous discovery and requests a brief adjournment for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Curtis L Schmitt in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
Signed and Filed. ORDER REGARDING CONDITIONS OF BOND
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; ORDER REGARDNG CONDITIONS OF BOND
Received and Filed. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; STIPULATION REGARDNG CONDITIONS OF BOND
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Defendant's wife and children; Children under the age of 17 unless supervised by a responsible adult

Arguments heard on "Brief of Setting Bail" by the Court.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

09:39 AM Defendant Curtis L Schmitt in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Defendant Curtis L Schmitt in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis L Schmitt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
